meanings.definition: A rebellion or revolt against authority or established government.
meanings.sent1: The uprising in the story led to the people fighting against the king.
meanings.sent2: The citizens organized an uprising to protest the unfair laws.
meanings.sent3: The uprising at the school was when the students refused to do homework for a day.
meanings.sent4: The uprising of the flowers in the garden brought a burst of color to the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The uprising of the waves against the shore was a powerful sight.

meanings.definition: A sudden and violent outbreak of a group of people in opposition to an existing government or ruler.
meanings.sent1: During the uprising, the protestors clashed with the police in the streets.
meanings.sent2: The city was in chaos due to the sudden uprising of the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The uprising of the animals at the zoo was caused by a mischievous monkey letting them out of their cages.
meanings.sent4: The uprising of emotions in her heart made her speak out against the injustice.
meanings.sent5: The uprising of cheers from the crowd showed their support for the team.
